utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Let’s see, Raj was the Kung Palo Chicken.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m the dumplings.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes, you are.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Creepy, Howard.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Creepy good or creepy bad?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Who was the Shrimp with Lobster Sauce?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That would be me. Come to Poppa, you un-kosher delight. I’m not necessarily talking to the food.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sit over there.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (entering, to Penny who is in his spot)
utterance.content: Sit over there. Baby wipe?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What do you have….

utterance.speaker: Leonard and Howard together
utterance.content: Don’t! Don’t! Don’t!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ll tell you why.

utterance.speaker: Leonard and Howard
utterance.content: O-o-o-oh!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I had to sanitize my hands because the university replaced the paper towels in the rest rooms with hot air blowers.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I thought the blowers were more sanitary?

utterance.speaker: Leonard and Howard
utterance.content: Why? Don’t!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hot air blowers are incubators and spewers of bacteria and pestilence. Frankly it would be more hygienic if they just had a plague infested gibbon sneeze my hands dry.

utterance.speaker: Raj (entering excitedly)
utterance.content: Hey guys, I just got the most amazing new… ew-ew-ew

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Gosh, Raj, do you think you’ll ever be able to talk in front of me without being drunk? Okay, well, I’ll just, um, go eat by myself.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Penny, you don’t have to do that.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, it’s okay, between him not talking, him talking and… him, I’m better off alone, so, goodbye you poor strange little man

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: She’s so considerate.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So what’s your news?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Remember that little planetary object I spotted beyond the Kuiper belt?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh yeah, two zero zero eight NQ sub seventeen.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Or as I called it, Planet Bollywood. Anyway, because of my discovery, People magazine is naming me one of their thirty under-30 to watch.

utterance.speaker: Leonard and Howard together
utterance.content: Well, wow, that’s incredible.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me. Thirty what, under thirty what, to watch what?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Thirty visionaries under thirty years of age to watch as they challenge the preconceptions of their fields.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If I had a million guesses I never would have gotten that.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s pretty cool, they’ve got me in with a guy who’s doing something about hunger in Indonesia, and a psychotherapist who’s using dolphins to rehabilitate prisoners, and Ellen Page, star of the charming independent film Juno.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, I’d so do her.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’d do the dolphins.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Do I get an honourable mention for designing the telescope camera mounting bracket you used.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sorry, it’s not part of my heartwarming and personal narrative, in which a humble boy from New Delhi overcame poverty and prejudice and journeyed to America to reach for the stars.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Poverty? Your father’s a gynaecologist, he drives a Bentley.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s a lease.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m confused. Was there some sort of peer review committee to determine which scientists would be included?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Peer review? It’s People magazine. People picked me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What people?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: The people from People.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, but exactly who are these people? What are their credentials, how are they qualified, what makes accidentally noticing a hunk of rock that’s been traipsing around the solar system for billions of years more noteworthy than any other scientific accomplishment made by someone under thirty?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Boy, I bet Ellen Pages friends aren’t giving her this kind of crap.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are you proud of yourself?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: In general, yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, there’s my missing neutrino. You were hiding from me as an unbalanced charge, weren’t you, you little subatomic Dickens?

utterance.speaker: Leonard (entering with Howard)
utterance.content: Hi Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Here, look, look, I found my missing neutrino.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, good, we can take it off the milk cartons.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, we’re going to go apologise to Raj and invite him out to dinner.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Apologise, for what?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, he came over last night with some pretty good news, and we weren’t very supportive.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I sense you’re trying to tell me something.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You were a colossal ass-hat.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh! No, I beg to differ. Of the three of us, I was by far the most supportive.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really, do tell.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How will Raj ever reach true greatness if his friends lower the bar for him? When I was eleven, my sister bought our father a “world’s greatest dad” coffee mug, and frankly the man coasted until the day he died.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, let’s try it this way, what if the People magazine thing is the best Raj is ever going to achieve?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I had not considered that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I often forget other people have limitations. It’s so sad.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: He can feel sadness?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Not really, it’s what you and I would call condescension.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And when we go in there, let’s show Raj that we’re happy for him.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But I’m not.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well then fake it. Look at me, I could be grinding on the fact that without my stabilizing telescope mount he never would have found that stupid little clump of cosmic schmutz, but I’m bigger than that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine, what do you want me to do?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Smile.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh crap, that’s terrifying.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We’re here to see Koothrappali, not kill Batman.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Try less teeth.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Close enough, come on. Hi Raj.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey guys, what’s up?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We just wanted to invite you out to dinner tonight.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Celebrate your thirty under thirty thing. Right Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s very nice of you, I would like that.

utterance.speaker: Gablehauser (entering)
utterance.content: Hello boys.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Dr Gablehouser.

utterance.speaker: Gablehauser
utterance.content: Dr Koothrappali.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Dr Gablehauser.

utterance.speaker: Gablehauser
utterance.content: Dr Hoffstadter.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Dr Gablehauser.

utterance.speaker: Gablehauser
utterance.content: Dr Cooper.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Dr Gablehauser.

utterance.speaker: Gablehauser
utterance.content: Mister Wolowitz. Boys, I’ve got a question for you. Who in this room discovered a star?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Actually, 2008 NQ sub 17 is a planetary body.

utterance.speaker: Gablehauser
utterance.content: I’m not talking about you, I’m talking about me. You, my exotic young friend are my star.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, you didn’t discover him, you merely noticed he was here, much like he did with 2008 NQ sub 17.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, sorry.

utterance.speaker: Gablehauser
utterance.content: Well, we’ve got to get you into a better office, something more suited to your status.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Really, you don’t have to go to any trouble.

utterance.speaker: Gablehauser
utterance.content: How about if I put you in Von Gerlick’s old office?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’d rather have Fishbine’s, it’s bigger.

utterance.speaker: Gablehauser
utterance.content: Done.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wait a minute, I called dibs on Fishbine’s office the day he started showing up at work in his bathrobe.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: He gets a new office, I can’t even get paper towels in the men’s room?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Damn, this is hard.

utterance.speaker: Gablehauser
utterance.content: Let me ask you something, what do you think the business of this place is?

utterance.speaker: Leonard (after he, Sheldon and Howard whisper to each other)
utterance.content: Science?

utterance.speaker: Gablehauser
utterance.content: Money.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Told you.

utterance.speaker: Gablehauser
utterance.content: And this boy’s picture in People magazine is going to raise us a pile of money taller than… well, taller than you

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I have a master’s degree.

utterance.speaker: Gablehauser
utterance.content: Who doesn’t? Dr Koothrappali, have you ever had lunch in the President’s dining room?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I didn’t even know there was a President’s dining room.

utterance.speaker: Gablehauser
utterance.content: It’s the same food as the Cafeteria, only fresh. Come on little buddy.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, big buddy. See you tonight guys.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You can stop smiling now.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Aaaah!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So anyway, after a fantastic lunch I was whisked off to the People magazine photo shoot… have any of you boys ever been to a photo shoot?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s fantastic, apparently the camera loves me and I it. They shot me in front of a starry background where I posed like this. They’re going to digitally add a supernova, they say it’s the perfect metaphor for my incandescent talent.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Right, a ball of hot flaming gas that collapses in on itself.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Excuse me. Oh, it’s my assistant Trevor. Go for Koothrappali. Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: They gave him an assistant? If I want a new pen I have to go to the bank with wire cutters.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (still smiling)
utterance.content: Have we at this point met our social obligations?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Not yet.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, just put it on my calendar but start thinking of a reason why I can’t go, alrighty? Koothrappali out. God bless that boy, I don’t know what I’d do without him.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You just got him this afternoon.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yes, but I’m finding that having a lackey suits me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: A lackey?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, I’m sorry, is that politically incorrect? In India we just call them untouchables.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Now?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Almost.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Speaking of untouchables, I’ve got great news for you guys. People magazine is having a reception this Saturday, and I managed to get you invited.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, gee, thanks.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, you’re welcome. Of course, I couldn’t get you into the VIP section, because, you know, that’s for VIPs, and you guys are just, you know, Ps.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There’s a tribe in Papua New Guinea where, when a hunter flaunts his success to the rest of the village they kill him, and drive away evil spirits with a drum made of his skin. Superstitious nonsense of course, but one can see their point.

utterance.speaker: Penny (bringing another grasshopper)
utterance.content: Here you go, Raj, you might want to drink this one slowly.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, so, Saturday night, can I count on my posse?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Gee, I’d love to Raj, but I can’t make it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, okay, Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, uh, no I… the… no.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I can make it, but I won’t.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What are you guys talking about?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, there’s a reception for my magazine article on Saturday.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: And you guys aren’t going? I can’t believe you, Raj is celebrating a tremendous accomplishment and you’re not even going to be there to support him?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: A tremendous accomplishment would be if the planetary body he discovered were plummeting toward Earth and he exploded it with his mind.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That would be cool. I’d go to that reception.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Come on, this is huge, Raj is going to be in People magazine. And he didn’t even have to knock up one of the Spears sisters.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Would you like to go with me?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Of course I would, I would be honoured.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Really? Cool.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Shame on you guys.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Look at that. I got a date with Penny. I can’t believe it took you a whole year.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Now?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Now.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, buddy. I’m going to be in people magazine.

utterance.speaker: Charlie Sheen (turning round)
utterance.content: Yeah, call me when you’re on the cover.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, Raj, look at you!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I know, I am resplendent like the noonday sun, am I not?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um, yeah, starting with the champagne a little early aren’t you?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It was in the limo. They sent a limo. I have a limo. I just love saying limo. Here, sip on this while you’re getting ready.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, I’m ready.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That’s what you’re wearing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um, yeah, why what’s wrong with it?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Nothing, I was just hoping for something a little more, you know, redonkulous.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, well, this is all the donkulous you’re gonna get.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okey dokey, let’s roll. Alright, it’s time to raise the roof. Oo-ooh, oo-ooh.

utterance.speaker: Penny (to Leonard who is just coming up the stairs)
utterance.content: Hey Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Dude.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You look very nice.

utterance.speaker: Raj and Penny together
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, come on, good night Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Good night.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, Leonard, did you see my limo downstairs.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s bigger than the house my grandfather grew up in.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Terrific.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It has more food too.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Alright, come on, come on.

utterance.speaker: Raj (leaving, singing)
utterance.content: I’m coming up so you better get this party started.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (entering apartment)
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, good news, you don’t have to sulk about Penny any more, look, there are hundreds of Croatian women just waiting for you to contact them.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Anythingforagreencard.com?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’ll lend you my user name, it’s wealthybigpenis.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re joking.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, you gotta make it easy for them, they’re just learning English.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Pass.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So you’re just going to sit around here and mope while Penny is out with Doctor Apu from the Kwik-e-Mart?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s not a date, and that’s racist.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It can’t be racist, he’s a beloved character on the Simpsons.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Let’s just eat so I can get to bed. With any luck tonight will be the night my sleep apnoea kills me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Did you remember to ask for the chicken with broccoli to be diced not shredded?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Even though the menu description specifies shredded?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Brown rice, not white?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Did you stop at the Korean grocery and get the good hot mustard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Did you pick up the low sodium soy sauce from the market?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re welcome.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What took you so long?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Just sit down and eat.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Alright, it’s shredded, what do you want me to do?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I want you to check before you accept the order.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Were you distracted by the possibility that Koothrappali might have intercourse with Penny tonight?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He’s not going to have intercourse with Penny.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Then there’s no excuse for this chicken. You know, this situation with Koothrapali brings to mind a story from my childhood.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh goody, more tales from the panhandle.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s Northwest Texas, I’m from East Texas, the Gulf region, home to many Vietnamese shrimpers.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Do the shrimpers feature in your story?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. Anyway, when I was eight, a Montgomery-Ward delivery van ran over our cat, Lucky.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Lucky?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, Lucky.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He’s irony impaired, just move on.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, dead cat named Lucky, continue.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: While others mourned Lucky, I realised his untimely demise provided me with the opportunity to replace him with something more suited to my pet needs. A faithful companion that I could snuggle with at night, and yet would be capable of killing upon telepathic command.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So, not a puppy?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Please, no, nothing so pedestrian. I wanted a griffin.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: A griffin?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, half eagle, half lion.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And mythological.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Irrelevant. See, I was studying recombinant DNA technology and I was confident I could create one, but my parents were unwilling to secure the necessary eagle eggs and lion semen. Course my sister got swimming lessons when she wanted them.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sheldon, not that we don’t all enjoy a good lion semen story, what’s your point.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My point is, if Koothrappali is moving on to a new life of shallow, undeserved fame, perhaps this is an opportunity to create a better cohort.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You want to breed a new friend?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s one option, but who has the time? But consider this, the Japanese, they’re doing some wonderful work with artificial intelligence, now, you combine that with some animatronics from the imagineers over at Disney, next thing you know, we’re playing Halo with a multi-lingual Abraham Lincoln.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sheldon, don’t take this the wrong way, but, you’re insane.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That may well be, but the fact is, it wouldn’t kill us to meet some new people.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh, for the record, it could kill us to meet new people. They could be murderers, or the carriers of unusual pathogens, and I’m not insane, my mother had me tested.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: If we do get a new friend, he should be a guy you can trust. A guy who has your back.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And he should have a lot of money, and live in a cool place down by the beach where we could throw parties.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: He should share our love of technology.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And he should know a lot of women.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, let’s see, money, women, technology, okay we’re agreed, our new friend is going to be Iron Man.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Welcome to the Raj Mahal.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes, it’s very nice, goodnight Raj.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, wait, the evening’s not over.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes it is.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, it’s time to put on some R. Kelly and suck face.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, wow, is the evening over.

utterance.speaker: Raj (as a ringing noise is heard)
utterance.content: Wait, wait, that’s my mummy and daddy calling from India. I want you to meet my parents.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wait, meet them.

utterance.speaker: Raj (inhales deeply, picks up laptop, presses a button. His mother and father appear on the screen)
utterance.content: Hello mummy and daddy, good to see you. I’m not drunk.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Koothrappali
utterance.content: Why would you say that?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Just making conversation. Mummy, daddy, I want you to meet my new squeeze, Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I am not your squeeze. There is no squeezing.

utterance.speaker: Dr Koothrappali
utterance.content: I can’t see her, centre her in the frame.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Here you go, cute huh?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Koothrappali
utterance.content: She’s not Indian.

utterance.speaker: Dr Koothrappali
utterance.content: So, she’s not Indian, the boy’s just sowing some wild oats.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, no, there’s no sowing, no squeezing, and no sucking face.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Koothrappali
utterance.content: What if he gets her pregnant. Is this little hotsy-totsy who you want as the mother of your grandchildren.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What right do you have to pick who I can have children with?

utterance.speaker: Dr Koothrappali
utterance.content: Look, Rajesh, I understand, you’re in America, you want to try the local cuisine. But trust me, you don’t want it for a steady diet.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Now you listen to me, I am no longer a child, and I will not be spoken to like one. Now if you’d excuse me, I have to go throw up.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Koothrappali
utterance.content: What’s wrong with him?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t know, maybe it’s the local cuisine. Okay, well, it’s nice to meet you, just gonna set you on down over here, and I’m going to leave so, Namaste. And FYI, you’d be lucky to have me as a daughter-in-law.

utterance.speaker: Dr Koothrappali
utterance.content: She’s feisty. I like that.

utterance.speaker: Penny (opening door to find Raj outside)
utterance.content: Raj, what are you doing. . No. No notes. If you have something to say to me, say it.

utterance.speaker: Raj (tries several times. Finally, in a high pitched squeak)
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, sweetie, it’s okay.
